info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 7:08PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Catawba, southern Alexander, west central Iredell, southeastern Caldwell and eastern Burke Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 708 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hickory, or near Bethlehem, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Hickory, Newton, St. Stephens, Conover, Longview, Granite Falls, Bethlehem, Icard, Hildebran and Claremont. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
